result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen J. Greene was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allen J. Greene is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Allen J. Greene was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen J. Greene

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Allen J. Greene in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CV76 tracking with 16CF48:

  16CV76:
Atty Hendee received a title for a 2012 Chevy that was turned over to Marquette County.  Atty Hendee states that based on that, the State moves to dismiss the civil matter.
Atty Johnson agrees.
BY THE COURT:  16CV76 will be dismissed.

16CF48:
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Possession of Schedule II Narcotics 961.41(3g)(am), Class I Felony.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee states that neither party is requesting a PSI.
  Court notes that there was no waiver of a Prelim done on the case yet.   Atty Johnson states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Johnson has no objection moving forward without a hard copy.   Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend Ct. 1 to Possession of Schedule II Narcotics 961.41(3g)(am), Class I Felony.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the information for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1. 
Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.


BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Pay fine $150 + costs = $858.75 (includes DNA surcharge)
DNA Sample
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
No PSI will be ordered.
Cash bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CV76 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the parties are working on resolution for both matters.  Atty Johnson agrees and asks for another plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued

Atty Johnson states that the civil matter may be resolved before the next date and asks the court if there is an objection to resolving it by stipulation.
BY THE COURT:  Court has no objection to the civil matter being resolved by a stip.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2017 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties are close to resolution and will be asking for another date.  Atty Johnson agrees and asks that a plea be set out 60 days.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Return date on January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant lives in Alabama.  Atty Johnson agrees and has not had time to meet with the DA on this yet.  

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

DA Cover Letter to Clerk w/Discovery Demand
Status conference on November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

filed by Atty Johnson
Status conference on October 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for Defendant Allen J. Greene. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Allen J. Greene appeared by phone means.
  Atty Johnson states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Johnson waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Status.
If it is just a Status the defendant will not have to appear; if it turns into a Plea/Sentencing hearing, the defendant will need to appear in person.
bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Criminal Complaint served on Defendant by MASO/Jail 08-16-16
Initial appearance on August 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
*No special conditions

Defendant Allen J. Greene in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court did not receive a copy of the criminal complaint so there will just be a bond hearing today.  Atty Hendee states charges.  Court finds probable cause to proceed.  
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  
Atty Hendee requests a $5,000 cash bond; no special conditions.
Defendant asks for a reduced cash bond.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 Cash bond with conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
